abstract: Few understand how much we spend on health care, how much we need to spend to provide quality care, and the difference between the two.
snippet: Few understand how much we spend on health care, how much we need to spend to provide quality care, and the difference between the two.
lead_paragraph: If you have heard it once, you have heard it hundreds of times. "The United States spends too much on health care." This is not a partisan point. You can hear this from Republicans as well as Democrats. "We know that our families, our economy and our nation itself will not succeed in the 21st century if we continue to be held down by the weight of rapidly rising health care costs," President Obama said in 2009. Representative Paul D. Ryan, Republican of Wisconsin, agrees: "There is no serious dispute - on either side of the aisle."

headline.main: Spending More Doesn't Make Us Healthier
